<title level="1" pfs="Limited">[Crucidaemon (Torture Daemon)](/Monsters.aspx?ID=479)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Of all the ways to die, crucidaemons represent perhaps one of the least desirable: death by torture. The fiend’s shapely body, which appears to be sculpted from iron or mithril, belies a sinister wrath and love of inflicting pain. Crucidaemons particularly enjoy inflicting pain with their curved, serrated daggers, which are attached to their bodies via a chain that pierces each wrist.

 A crucidaemon’s existence is dedicated to subjecting its prey to an eternity of pain and terror. Unlike other daemons, many of which are eager to feed on mortal souls as soon as they can, the crucidaemon takes much greater pleasure in prolonging the agony of its victims. Oftentimes, a crucidaemon will inflict such torment and pain upon its prey that when the end finally comes, the victim tearfully thanks the daemon for the mercy of oblivion. An encounter with a crucidaemon that does not end with its death is far from over—crucidaemons have unequaled patience for those who dare oppose them.

<title level="2" right="Creature 15">[Crucidaemon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=479)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Daemon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=213" />
<trait label="Fiend" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=70" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad](/Sources.aspx?ID=14) pg. 85</row>

**Perception** +26; darkvision, [_detect alignment_](/Spells.aspx?ID=65) (good only), lifesense 30 feet

**Languages**
[Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19); telepathy 100 feet

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +30, [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +26, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +30, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +26, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +28, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +30, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) +26

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +4

**Dex** +7

**Con** +7

**Int** +3

**Wis** +7

**Cha** +5
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 38 

**Fort** +26 

**Ref** +30 

**Will** +26 

+1 status to all saves vs. magic
</row>

**HP** 225

**Immunities**
death effects

**Resistances**
physical 10 (except adamantine)

**Weaknesses**
good 10

**Trap Dodger** Crucidaemons are all but impossible to fool with traps. Whenever a crucidaemon rolls a saving throw against a trap hazard, its degree of success is one better than it rolled.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 50 feet, [_air walk_](/Spells.aspx?ID=6)

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
chained dagger +30 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 4d4+14 piercing plus 2d6 [persistent](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) bleed

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 32, attack +28
- **4th**
[Death Knell](/Spells.aspx?ID=63), [Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110), [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164) (at will), [Phantom Pain](/Spells.aspx?ID=220) (at will)
- **7th**
[Glyph of Warding](/Spells.aspx?ID=138) (x3), [Paralyze](/Spells.aspx?ID=213)
- **Constant (2nd)**
[Detect Alignment](/Spells.aspx?ID=65) (good only)

**Daemonic Trap Making**  ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) When the crucidaemon casts its innate [_glyph of warding_](/Spells.aspx?ID=138) spell, it can store any arcane or divine spell of an appropriate level in the glyph, even if it can’t otherwise cast the spell.

**Flurry of Daggers** <actions string="Single Action" />  The crucidaemon makes two chained dagger Strikes against a single target. These attacks count toward the crucidaemon’s multiple attack penalty and its multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after both attacks.

**Manifest Dagger** <actions string="Single Action" />  The crucidaemon summons a new chained dagger to replace a destroyed one. A crucidaemon’s daggers can’t be disarmed, and they become non-magical when severed from the daemon or upon the daemon’s death.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_3_Locations.png">Daemonic Trapmakers</title>

Crucidaemons excel at trapmaking, and they line their lairs or the lairs of their masters with mazes of intricate and deadly traps and enchanted _[glyphs of warding_](/Spells.aspx?ID=138) through which they draw their victims. Perhaps even eerier than the crucidaemon’s methodical nature in trapmaking is its nearly medical interest in the mutilation and crippling of captured foes.
</aside>

name: Crucidaemon
